description: Shadow Library room - a Tier 1 L-shaped research room producing Research points with 3 upgrade paths and adjacency bonuses

userStories.title: Shadow Library Room Definition
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the Shadow Library defined in YAML gamedata so that it is available through the content pipeline
acceptanceCriteria: A shadow-library.yaml file exists in the appropriate gamedata/ directory
Fields include: id, name, description, shape, baseTiles, baseProduction, maxInhabitants, baseFearLevel, upgradePaths
The shape is L-shaped
Base fear level is Medium (2)
The YAML compiles to valid JSON via npm run gamedata:build
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: L-Shaped Room Placement
userStories.description: As a dungeon builder, I want to place the Shadow Library as an L-shaped room on the grid
acceptanceCriteria: The Shadow Library occupies an L-shaped set of tiles
The room can be rotated (4 orientations) during placement
Placement validates that all tiles are unoccupied
Renders correctly on the grid
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Base Research Production
userStories.description: As a dungeon builder, I want the Shadow Library to produce 3 Research per minute so that I can unlock upgrades
acceptanceCriteria: The Library produces 3 Research per minute when 1 inhabitant is assigned
Production is added to the Research resource pool via ResourceManager
Production is visible in the resource display
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Limited Inhabitant Capacity
userStories.description: As a dungeon builder, I want the Shadow Library to hold only 1 inhabitant (3 when upgraded) reflecting its specialized nature
acceptanceCriteria: Base capacity is 1 inhabitant
Attempting to assign a 2nd inhabitant is rejected with feedback
After capacity upgrade, limit increases to 3
Current/max count displayed on room UI
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Medium Fear Level
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the Shadow Library to have medium base fear reflecting its dark scholarly atmosphere
acceptanceCriteria: Base fear level is Medium (2)
Fear level is included in the gamedata definition
Some inhabitants may refuse to work here due to fear threshold
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Upgrade Path - Arcane Focus
userStories.description: As a dungeon builder, I want a research-boosting upgrade path for the Shadow Library
acceptanceCriteria: Upgrade significantly increases Research production (e.g. +75%)
Upgrade has a defined resource cost
Mutually exclusive with other paths at this tier
Effect applies immediately
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Upgrade Path - Expanded Archives
userStories.description: As a dungeon builder, I want a capacity upgrade for the Shadow Library
acceptanceCriteria: Upgrade increases max inhabitants from 1 to 3
Upgrade has a defined resource cost
Mutually exclusive with other paths at this tier
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Upgrade Path - Forbidden Knowledge
userStories.description: As a dungeon builder, I want a specialization upgrade with unique effects for the Shadow Library
acceptanceCriteria: Upgrade provides a unique effect such as increased fear with greatly boosted production
Upgrade has a defined resource cost
Mutually exclusive with other paths at this tier
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Adjacency Bonuses
userStories.description: As a dungeon builder, I want the Shadow Library to benefit from adjacency with complementary rooms
acceptanceCriteria: Library + Mine adjacency provides a defined bonus (e.g. +15% to both)
Library + Library adjacency provides a defined bonus (e.g. +20% Research each)
Bonuses activate via the adjacency bonus system
Typecheck passes
